newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russian MinFins firm following U.S. bond, Bulgaria.
newsitem.headline: Russian MinFins firm following U.S. bond, Bulgaria.

text.p: Some MinFin bonds firmed on Tuesday following a rise in U.S. Treasuries and Bulgaria Bradys, dealers said.
"We are a bit higher, there is a lot of buying from London," a Moscow Narodny Bank dealer said. "The long (U.S. Treasury) bond is firmer than yesterday and Bulgaria is rising."
Bulgaria moved into the Brady market spotlight on Tuesday as investors pushed prices up towards recent highs with more upside potential seen.
U.S. Treasuries in London recovered after selling in Tokyo.
The market edged up in the morning with most rise in tranches 5 and 7, but in the afternoon it calmed down, as orders were fulfilled," said an Avtobank dealer Alla Zakharova.
She said she saw most Western buying in tranches 5 and 7.
News that President Boris Yeltsin would not return to the Kremlin soon made no impact on the market, Zakharova said.
"It caused nothing, but dealers' smiles," she said.
Yeltsin is recovering slowly from pneumonia, and will not return to the Kremlin quickly, his press secretary said on Tuesday.
Zakharova forecast tranche 5 would soon hit 44.00 at bid.
"The market is almost ready for that," she said.
The Moscow Narodny Bank dealer said the market was waiting for the U.S. jobless claims, retail sales, business inventories and PPI index to be released on Thursday and Friday.
